events.description:
A local farmer, forlorn and dishevelled, pays you a visit. He looks exhausted.
"Yer majesty, my crops 'ave failed and I 'ave nothing to trade at market this year. I fear me family will starve this winter. Please, can ye 'elp a loyal subject?"
Do you want to compensate the farmer or ignore his plea for help?

choices.description: Compensate Fred for 30 gold pieces
Ignore Fred's plea
Kill Fred

events.description:
Your regular milkman, out on his daily rounds, comes to deliver your usual two pints of fresh, creamy milk.
"Here you go, sire, your usual. That will be 20 gold pieces."

choices.description: Pay Martin 20 gold pieces for your milk
Take the milk and refuse to pay
Kill Martin

events.description:
A lone, hooded figure approaches your throne. His head hangs low, his face not visible. He speaks with a low, gruff voice.
"I live a simple life of solitude, my lord, out in the woods. However, recently some suspicious looking folk have been encroaching, getting nearer and nearer to my hermit hut. I fear that my way of life is threatened. Could you help?"

choices.description: Set up a Hermit Conservation Zone for 60 gold pieces
Arrest Hubert for living on your land without permission
Kill Hubert

events.description:
Your personal PR Specialist, who in the past has helped you out of some tight spots, arrives in your throne room.
"Having trouble pleasing the people, sire? Killed off too many peasants? Show me the gold and I can make all of your problems go away!"

choices.description: Pay 150 gold pieces for some good publicity
You don't need to pay an expert - your actions speak for themselves!
Kill Polly

events.description:
The local baker, a jolly, plump man with an impressive handlebar moustache, approaches. His hands and apron are coated in a fine layer of flour and the homely aroma of freshly baked bread follows him.
"My lord, I'm sick and tired of baking bread all of the time. What I would love more than anything in the world is to move into French patisserie. Could you help?"

choices.description: Send for the finest pastry chef in all of France to train Bob, a bargain at only 30 gold pieces!
Tell Bob that he's already good enough to produce fine pastries.
Kill Bob

events.description:
Your green-fingered gardener, who has been tending the castle gardens for as long as you can remember, comes forth. He seems unusually reserved, but after some prompting finally speaks up.
"Your majesty, I have worked tirelessly in these gardens for over 30 years, and have, as of yet, never taken a day of leave. However, my dear sweet wife Gertrude is ill, and I must look after her. Please may I have some time off?"

choices.description: Allow Garfield to take as much leave as he requires, and pay 40 gold pieces for the finest physician to treat his wife
Give Garfield a week off - after all, he deserves it!
Kill Garfield

events.description:
Silence prevails as your wonderful, hilarious, foolish, dim-witted jester stops dancing, the tiny bells on his hat coming to a rest. He coughs pronouncedly to get your attention.
"Beg your pardon, sire, but I can't help but feel that my outfit makes me look foolish and dim-witted. Would it be possible to dress me in an alternate attire?"

choices.description: Buy Jim a new, more respectable outfit for a mere 15 gold pieces
Ignore Jim - he's using big, long words that he doesn't even understand
Kill Jim

events.description:
The local butcher, the most terrifying, formidable and imposing woman you've ever met, is at your threshold. As she tries to enter the throne room, her apron stained with dry blood and a cleaver in one hand, a basket in the other, your guards try to block her way, but you command them to let her pass. This woman supplies you with the finest sausages in the entire kingdom!
"Oi, I have that barbeque pack you asked for. I've got sausages, burgers, a couple of steaks and a few rashers of bacon."

choices.description: Thank Bertha and pay her her due of 25 gold pieces
Take the barbeque pack as an offering and refuse to pay for it
Kill Bertha

events.description:
A much loved and respected member of the community, Charles the Chaplain can usually be found residing in the castle chapel. Today, however, he has come to you with a plea close to his heart.
"Sire, our chapel's Bibles are old and worn. They are in dire need of replacing. Please, could you allocate the funds for me to purchase a new set of Bibles?"

choices.description: Give Charles 50 gold pieces for the Bibles
Find a new chaplain who won't make such unreasonable demands
Kill Charles

events.description:
Chesley the Chamberlain is your most trusted member of staff, the man in charge of all domestic affairs at the castle. Usually, he is an exceedingly capable man, and it is only on the rarest of occasions that he feels the need to bother you. Today is such an occasion, and he enters the throne room in a hurry, a stern look of worry upon his face.
"Your majesty, pardon my intrusion, but I have a matter I need to discuss with you. One of your servants, a young maid by the name of Mildred, has been caught trying to steal some of our silverware. What would you like me to do?"

choices.description: Let Mildred off with a warning
Execute Mildred as a warning to other potential thieves
Kill Chesley

events.description:
The joy of being the ruler of such a wealthy and prosperous nation is that endless people desire to trade with you. One such individual is Michael the Merchant, who has come to show off his range of 'quality' goods.
"Good day, good day! I come to you with a real bargain, my lord! Would you like to buy one of these authentic Rolex watches for a mere 40 gold pieces?"

choices.description: Buy an 'authentic' Rolex watch for 40 gold pieces
Send Michael on his way so that he can try to work his charm on some other mug
Kill Michael

events.description:
Living in such luscious lands means that a plethora of animals abide. Many local people making their livings from hunting the various animals that live in the woodland and beyond. Hatty, a highly skilled and experienced hunter, has come to sell you her daily catch.
"My lord, I have some magnificent wild boar for you today, freshly caught this very morning. Would you be interested in purchasing one? It would make a most splendid centrepiece at a dinner party!"

choices.description: Buy a boar for 25 gold pieces
Throw Hatty in the dungeons for killing your boar without permission and take her earnings
Kill Hatty

events.description:
You barely have time to see your wife any more, as you seem to spend more and more of your life dealing with the trivial matters of the proletariat. Indeed, as your wife initially steps forth to speak with you, you fail to recognise her. You don't remember her having blue eyes...
"Dearest, I'm sorry to bother you whilst you are working, but it is our son's birthday soon, and I was wondering what you would like to do to mark the occasion? He'll be 8, by the way, just in case you'd forgotten..."

choices.description: Spend 60 gold pieces to arrange the most spectacular party the kingdom has ever seen. He is your heir, after all!
Buy him a puppy for 10 gold pieces and let that be it. These are testing times, after all!
Kill Wendy

events.description:
A small boy approaches. He looks weak and frail, and you pity the parents of such a pathetic, lowly sprat. As the boy comes closer, you realise that he is in fact Spencer, your son. You hastily retract your previous thoughts. My, what a strong, handsome and magnificent lad he is!
"Father, I want to learn how to play with swords. They look like so much fun. Please, may I?"

choices.description: Give Spencer a training sword to play with. He'll make a warrior yet!
Refuse Spencer's request. Swords are not toys. Anyway, he doesn't look strong enough to even lift a sword!
Kill Spencer

events.description: Your sweet, innocent daughter toddles up to you. Oh, to be a child again... She knows nothing of the pains of love, death or taxes. Dorothy has her mother's eyes and your determined and adventurous spirit. Who else would dare approach the king without an appointment? Speaking of not having an appointment, where is Dorothy's nanny?

choices.description: Pick up Dorothy and give her a cuddle. Who cares where the nanny is?
Arrest the nanny and throw her in the dungeons for neglecting her duties
Kill the nanny

events.description: They say that a dog is a man's best friend, and how right they are! Boris, your trusty bloodhound, has been at your side since your coronation, and has stuck by you through even the most difficult decisions, never criticising, never judging. He is the perfect companion!

choices.description: Give Boris a stroke behind the ears, just where he likes it
Give Boris the chicken drumstick that you have left over from your lunch
Kill Boris

events.description:
It is an unwritten law that every man must despise his mother-in-law, and yet in the case of Meryl, no law - written or unwritten - is necessary. She is a sly, mischievous creature who can't be trusted. Why oh why did you agree to let her stay in your castle?
"Hey, king! It's awful lonely being a widow, all alone in this big, empty castle. I demand that you find me a suitor!"

choices.description: Empty? There are men absolutely everywhere! Meryl can find her own husband!
Set up a date for Meryl with some poor fool from the dungeons. That should keep her quiet.
Kill Meryl

events.description:
Mortimer, the head of your army, rushes in. He is clad from head to toe in iron armour, and the very fact that he is able to rush anywhere is a glowing testament to his fortitude. Almost as an afterthought, he swiftly removes his helmet as he steps up to you.
"Your majesty, those curs from the neighbouring kingdom are lining their forces up along our border. I fear they mean to invade! What would you have me do?"

choices.description: Rally the troops - we're going to war! It will cost 60 gold pieces, mind!
Dispatch a diplomat in the hope of a peaceful resolution
Kill Mortimer

events.description:
Diplomacy is such a bore! Unfortunately, when you are the ruler of a kingdom things can very easily go sour with neighbouring kingdoms. Ususally your legion of diplomats are able to deal with most issues, but every so often there is a matter that requires your personal attention, such as when diplomats visit from other kingdoms. Danny is one such diplomat, although you haven't the foggiest where he's come from...
"Good day to you, your majesty. I have come from a far away kingdom in the hope of setting up a trade deal between our two great nations.  What do you say?"

choices.description: Sharing is caring - let's trade!
Your kingdom is by far the wealthiest and most prosperous - you have no need to trade!
Kill Danny

events.description:
An old, bearded man approaches. You can easily identify him as a diplomat from his fine silk robes and the silly hat that sits atop his head. Furthermore, he possesses an impressive beard, as any diplomat worth his weight in salt should. Sometimes you feel like it is really diplomats who are ruling the world. You make a mental note to yourself to draft a law outlawing all diplomats. That will show them who's boss!
"Sire, my lord, who, as you know, has been very generous to you in the past, is waging a war and requests assistance. He requires both gold and troops if there is even the slightest of chances that we might win."

choices.description: Give 50 gold pieces and send as many soldiers as you can spare to fight your ally's war
Send the soliders but keep the gold - money doesn't grow on trees, you know!
Kill Donald

events.description:
As Desmond the Diplomat nears, you wonder whether all boys whose names begin with the letter 'D' are destined for careers in diplomacy...
"Your majesty, my good lord demands a payment of 80 gold pieces, or else he threatens to spread a rumour that you are a eunuch!"

choices.description: Pay 80 gold pieces to maintain your dignity
That makes no sense - you have two children! Refuse to submit to this scandalous attempt at blackmail
Kill Desmond

events.description: You tune in to the background music, which has been playing near-constantly for as long as you can remember. Man, it is an awful racket! The lute - what an instrument! No bard, in the history of bardship, has ever made a lute sound good, which begs the question as to why it is the bard's chosen instrument? Bards sing songs of brave and honourable heroes - if only they could actually play good music...

choices.description: Dismiss Bertie and crack out your dusty boombox - everybody will thank you... except perhaps Bertie
Allow Bertie to continue to play, but make him pay you for the privilege
Kill Bertie

events.description:
Your army is the finest in all the kingdoms, due in part to the rigorous training programme imposed by Mortimer the Marshal. Despite this, there remain individuals who just grab a sword and some old, rusty armour and pronounce themselves 'swords-for-hire'. Simon represents all that is wrong with the world - he helps other people, but only for his own profit!
 "I'm a top-rate monster slayer, your majesty. Any monsters you need slaying? I can bring you their 'eads, eyes, tongues, tails, wings, claws - whatever you want!"

choices.description: Pay 40 gold pieces and send Simon on a long and dangerous quest to deal with that minotaur that's been bothering you for the past couple of years, but which you previously chose to ignore in the hope that it would simply disappear
Arrest Simon for slaying monsters without the correct paperwork
Kill Simon

events.description:
You always do your best to eat your 5-a-day, and sometimes you go to the trouble of having 6, just to be on the safe side. Your ally in this is Gary, the finest greengrocer ever to have walked the Earth, capable of acquiring any fruit or vegetable you could think to ask for. Just don't ask him how he does it!
"Sire, there are some terribly hungry looking wolves prowling around my orchard, and I don't feel safe to go there to pick my gloriously sweet, crunchy, juicy apples (only 1 gold piece each!) Please, could you send some soldiers down there to deal with the wolves for me? I'm sure I can make it worth your while!"

choices.description: Send two soldiers to the orchard to deal with the wolves
Demand a payment from Gary, then send a lone soldier to the orchard to complete the job
Kill Gary

events.description:
Colin the Candlestick Maker, you have to admit, looks an awful lot like a candlestick himself: he's an incredibly tall and slim chap, and his amusing orange quiff somewhat resembles a flame. You laugh to yourself as he comes forth.
"Good day, my lord. I'm sorry to bother you, but I was wondering if I could borrow those wonderous candlesticks that I made for you last month? Only, my mother-in-law is visiting this weekend and I could really do with something to brighten up my house and impress her, and I cannot make more as I don't have the raw materials required. What do you say?"

choices.description: You understand the horrors of the mother-in-law better than most - lend the candlesticks to Colin, along with your best wishes
You feel Colin's pain, but those candlesticks are currently doing a great job earning you the respect of the bourgeoisie. If you lose them, even temporarily, your reputation would be at stake!
Kill Colin

events.description: Charlotte, your head chef, is in charge of baking a magnificent cake for your son's upcoming birthday, along with a vast and varied birthday feast. This special occasion has been in the making for several months, and it cost a great deal to acquire the rare and splendid elements required to bring it all together. She comes to you now with a problem: there is no truffle oil in the castle!

choices.description: Send Charlotte out with Pansie the Pig to find some wild truffles to use
Give Charlotte 20 gold pieces, with which to acquire the finest truffle oil - nothing is too good for your son!
Kill Charlotte

events.description: As king, you wear only the finest silks, and set new and bold fashion trends that are quickly adopted by the bourgeoisie in their pitiful attempts to please you. Your personal tailor, Terrence, plays a crucial role in this, bringing exciting new materials to dress you in. On this occasion, he has just finished fitting you for a beautiful cloak of crimson red, made from the silk of free range silk worms from the Far East.

choices.description: Pay Terrence 25 gold pieces for the cloak and send him on his way
Ignoring his demands for payment, thank Terrence for his fine gift and send him on his way
Kill Terrence

events.description: Ever heard the saying, 'An army marches on its stomach'? Well, actually an army marches on its boots. You don't want your soldiers all getting blisters, gangrene, athelete's foot, or some other foot-related problems. Christoph sorts all that for you with his expertly-made boots. He comes to you today, however, as you have commissioned him to make new boots for the men in your barracks.

choices.description: Pay Christoph 100 gold pieces to make the finest leather boots that will serve your men well
Pay Christoph 25 gold pieces to make boots using some slightly dodgy material that you found around the back of the castle. It's not like you're going to be wearing the boots!
Kill Christoph

events.description: Upset your wife by forgetting your wedding anniversary? Buy her some flowers! Argued about whether her corset makes her bum look big? Buy her some flowers! Got a sneaking suspicion that your wife is annoyed at you but not sure why? Buy her some flowers! But which flowers will you buy from Fiona, the finest florest ever to arrange flowers?

choices.description: Pay Fiona 30 gold pieces for a beautiful bouquet of bright red roses - the perfect romantic gesture!
Pay Fiona 15 gold pieces for a bouquet of lilies. Lilies are pretty, right? They certaintly don't have any negative connotations...
Kill Fiona

events.description: With a castle full of people, you can't help but wonder how you managed to miss a parcel delivery last week. Thankfully, Paul the Postman has come to redeliver the parcel. However, there is a handling charge imposed by the post office!

choices.description: Pay Paul the handling charge of 10 gold pieces for your parcel
Refuse to pay the handling charge and take your parcel by force if need be
Kill Paul

events.description:
One ofthe many perks of being a ruler is that you have a plethora of servants at your command. On occasion, however, they can be quite demanding. Manfred comes up to you, a little too boldly and brashly.
"Your highness, I'm hoping to take the wife and children to the coast for a little getaway at the end of the month, but I noticed on the calendar that Megan the Maid is also due to be away then. Speaking man to man, do you think that you could... swap things around so that I can go on my holiday?"

choices.description: Juggle the calendar so that Manfred can go on his holiday but Megan cannot
Refuse Manfred's request - Megan booked her holiday first and you're no misogynist!
Kill Manfred

events.description: As your son's birthday is coming up, Ian, the local innkeeper, has offered to supply the alcohol for the party (for the adults, obviously!) However, he needs you to specify what you would rather have: beer or wine. Beer is a solid crowdpleaser, but wine is certainly the more sophisticated drink, and would win you the approval of the bourgeoisie that you so desperately crave (for reasons that are, as of yet, beyond your comprehension).

choices.description: Choose beer for the party and let everybody be merry!
Choose wine for the party and transform it into a respectable soiree!
Kill Ian

events.description: You are in the midst of a technological revolution! Incredible, ridiculous, crazy inventors all over the kingdom are applying themselves in an effort to create new and wonderful inventions that will improve the lives of very few wealthy citizens who can afford them. Ivan, your personal inventor, comes to you with his latest invention: an automated cart that carries you around, rather than being drawn by horses. He claims that it'll be all the rage in months and years to come.

choices.description: Support Ivan in his work and own the prototype autocart (powered by the blood of peasants)
It'll never catch on! Tell Ivan to go back to the drawing board
Kill Ivan

events.description:
Peter, a simple man with simple clothes, has come to visit you with a request. You seem to be getting a lot more simple folk coming to you with their problems these days. What they could probably do with is a working class hero.
"Excuse me, my lordship. There's a fayre happening in my village next week and I was hoping you could help to spread the word? I've made some fliers for you to distribute - they don't have any words on, because I can't read or write, but my sons drew some lovely pictures of lots of people having fun!"

choices.description: Agree to distribute Peter's fliers and spread word of the village fayre - perhaps you'll even make an appearance
Send Peter on his way then dispose of his fliers - you have more important matters to attend to
Kill Peter

events.description:
One of the joys of living in such rich, fertile lands is that there is an abundance of wildlife; one of the drawbacks is that there is also an abundance of farmers. Florence looks like a hardworking farmer at least, dirt clogging her nails and sweat dripping from her face as she addresses you.
"Your majesty, please hear my plea. Most of my sheep have been carried off by a fearsome dragon that is terrorising my farmland. I beg for you assistance in resolving this matter, my lord!"

choices.description: Send a unit of soldiers out to protect Florence's farm and hunt down the dragon
Compensate Florence with 35 gold pieces and resolve to stop the dragon
Kill Florence

events.description: A young lady comes to you in her hour of need begging for assistance. She tells you a woeful tale of how her evil stepmother and stepsisters lock her up and make her do all of the chores whilst they get fat off of all of her hard work. It reminds you of a famous fairytale...

choices.description: Ask your maids to help wash and dress Petunia, then invite her to your son's upcoming birthday party. Perhaps she'll meet a handsome prince?
Send Petunia back to her evil stepmother and stepsisters for a handsome reward
Kill Petunia

events.description:
Your insufferable younger brother, Bruce, has come to visit. He's always been resentful that you're the older brother, and jealous that he'll never sit on the throne.
"Alright, bro? You know, I have finally accepted that I won't be king. Still, it would be nice to sit on that big old throne of yours - just to, you know, see how it feels? So, how about it? It will only be for a minute!

choices.description: Be a generous big brother and let Bruce sit on your throne for exactly one minute
Refuse Bruce's request on the grounds that it is incredibly childish. Anyway, currently your throne fits your backside perfectly, and Bruce might ruin that somehow...
Kill Bruce

events.description:
In these times of deceit and subterfuge, nobody can be trusted. As such, you have your own spy ring, just as you suspect all the other kingdoms do. Sylvester, your spymaster, has come to you with important news. He's a creepy man: tall and slender, with a long, beak-like nose and a lisp that makes it sound like he's hissing. Still, he's extraordinarily good at his job.
"Your majesssty, I have sssome newsss for you. My ssspiesss have reported that two of our neighbouring rulersss are conssspiring againssst usss. They plan to overthrow you at the firssst opportunity. What would you have me do?"

choices.description: Remove both conspiring rulers from your Christmas card list - that will show them!
Go to war with both kingdoms simultaneously for a mere 75 gold pieces
Kill Sylvester

events.description:
For some reason, being king makes your life worth more than everybody else's. As such, you have a great many guards who protect you at all times. Strangely, all of their names begin with the letter 'G'. One of your guards has left his post to come and speak to you. You think it's Gabriel... or is it Gad? Gregor, perhaps?
"My liege, there's a large group of peasants amassing just outside of the castle walls. They're getting rather rowdy. Some of them have even made effigies of you, which they're threatening to burn! Shall I deal with them?"

choices.description: Burning effigies? That wouldn't look good for your public image. Ask Garth to quietly make the peasant mob 'disappear'
Give the peasant mob 25 gold pieces to go and amass somewhere else
Kill Garth

events.description:
Lilly looks after the vast assortment of books that are held in the castle library. You have collected copies of nearly every book currently in existence. If only you had time to actually read them...
"Sire, I'm having trouble obtaining a copy of that volume you asked for, 'Incredible Beasts and Where They Reside, Vol. 3'. I have heard that there might be a copy in one of the neighbouring kingdoms. Would you like me to go and check it out?"

choices.description: Absolutely! Send Lilly with 30 gold pieces to go and negotiate a price for the book
Absolutely! Ask Lilly to rendezvous with Sylvester the Spymaster in the hope of finding some way to steal the book
Kill Lilly

events.description: You wife employs a great many maids to carry out various tasks in and around the castle. You know Megan to be a quiet but hardworking girl, obedient and loyal. Yet today she comes to you with tears running down her cheeks, her eyes red and puffy. She tells you a sorrowful tale of how her betrothed, Bertie, lost his job, meaning that the pair can no longer afford to get married, as they were due to at the end of the month.

choices.description: Offer to employ Bertie as one of your guards, but insist that his name be changed to Gale
Offer to pay 25 gold pieces for Megan and Bertie's wedding on the condition that you be invited
Kill Megan

events.description:
Sorting out the plumbing in a castle of this size is a mighty job, requiring a whole team of highly-skilled plumbers. The plumbers are led by a jolly giant of a man, Patrick. Patrick is always smiling, which puts you on edge a little as nobody should smile that much...
"Good morning to you, my lord! Haha! What a glorious day it is! My boys and I were just running some maintenance on the plumbing in the sleeping quarters when we came across something rather nasty in the toilet of your en-suite! Haha! My, I'm not sure why I'm laughing so much, it was truly horrible..."

choices.description: Pay Patrick a nominal fee of 5 gold pieces to keep quiet about your dirty little secret
Laugh along uncomfortably with Patrick then refuse to discuss the matter - ever
Kill Patrick

events.description:
Your next visitor takes your breath away. She is dressed quite unlike anybody you have ever seen. Indeed, she wears items of clothing that you don't even know the names of, making it impossible to describe her appearance. She approaches you confidently, and addresses you as if she were chatting to a friend in the local tavern.
"Good day to you, King... err... King! My name is Teresa, and I am a time traveller from the future. I have travelled back to give you a warning. There are those conspire to overthrow you - your rulership is at risk! Act quickly or you will lose all that you hold dear!"

choices.description: How dare somebody else dress more fashionably than you! Throw Teresa in the dungeons and take possession of her time machine
Did this woman really just travel back in time to tell you something you already knew? Send Teresa on her way
Kill Teresa

events.description:
Your son's tutor, a fine, upstanding gentleman by the name of Trevor, has come to pay you a visit. It seems that he wishes to discuss your son's progress and attainment.
"Your royal highness, the good Prince Spencer is making... limited progress in all areas. I fear, my lord, that he is too easily distracted, and as such is not reaching the levels of attainment expected of a boy of his age..."

choices.description: Slip Trevor 10 gold pieces to improve your son's grades
Dismiss Trevor and find a new, better tutor who will shine a light on your son's natural skill
Kill Trevor

events.description:
Your bold and beautiful throne was made by a highly skilled carpenter by the name of Carlos, quite possibly the most talented carpenter alive. He has served you well over the years, and has come to visit you regarding another job.
"My lord, I need to discuss with you the specification for this shoe rack that you have requested I build."

choices.description: Pay 30 gold pieces for a shoe rack that is grand and mighty - a symbol of your strength and power as ruler of this kingdom!
Pay 10 gold pieces for a shoe rack that is modest but serves its purpose
Kill Carlos

events.description: Billy is a bull of a man, nearing seven feet tall with bulging biceps. He is always drenched with sweat, which isn't surprising considering he spends his days working at a forge. He is renowned as a master of his craft, and produces solid and sturdy, yet also precise and superly decorated pieces of armour. He has come today to fit you for a new breastplate.

choices.description: Let Billy do what Billy does best - splash the cash (a mere 45 gold pieces) for a bejeweled breastplate that will dazzle and astonish
Ask Billy to hold back on the unnecessary adornments - a simple breastplate for 25 gold pieces will do you just fine
Kill Billy

events.description:
Philosophers - just what are they for? They sit around all day thinking and debating, but to what end? Phillip does present himself as a wise man, mind, and he always gives good counsel.
"My lord, I do believe that I have stumbled upon a most important truth: war can never be justified, no matter the rationality behind it. As such, I believe that we should be a peaceful kingdom of pacifists."

choices.description: According to Plato, philosophers make the best kings. Abdicate and let Phillip take the throne
Phillip is clearly speaking nonsense - war is a natural part of rulership. Throw him in the dungeons
Kill Phillip

events.description: Alex is the apprentice of Merlin the Magician, and has been gradually learning the secrets of how to perform magic. He eagerly shows you a new trick that he has been taught, but he messes it up horrendously and just ends up making a fool of himself. He hangs his head in shame, fully aware of all of his mistakes.

choices.description: Congratulate Alex on his effort and lie about how well his trick went
Tell Alex the truth - he really sucks at magic!
Kill Alex

events.description:
Merlin the Magician struts around like he is the real deal, when, as a matter of fact, he is nothing more than a street magician. Nevertheless, he models himself after the wizard of legend, wearing a long, purple robe, pointy hat, and sporting a think beard.
"Your majesty, why do you employ so many servants here? Using my magic, I could easily get all of these chores performed for you!"

choices.description: Invite Merlin to try and perform all of your servants' chores simultaneously, leading to his inevitable humiliation
Politely decline Merlin's offer, explaining that magic is not real
Kill Merlin

events.description:
An exotic man, Phoenix is an expert physician, having trained after some other expert physician in some great hospital or another. He frequently visits the castle to performs check-ups on your entire family, and on this occasion comes with bad news.
"Your son is not well, my lord. He has contracted scurvy. I would recommend you switch him to a high-fruit diet before he gets any worse.

choices.description: Heed Phoenix's advice and make sure that Spencer is eating plenty of fruit
Secretly buy some dodgy Vitamin C supplements for 15 gold pieces so that nobody else finds out about the issue
Kill Phoenix
